tweets.text:
Invasive plant species are a real threat to our waterways & so some (such as floating pennywort) are illegal to sell. Disappointing that this plant is constantly for sale on @eBay_UK - from a seller who I have reported repeatedly over a 2 year period.   

https://t.co/F3PhtYGrhv https://t.co/ctNF8HvZs3

For those wondering why on earth the @PINSgov recommended planning approval for the #StonehengeTunnel - they didn‚Äôt! They recommended refusal, which is absolutely the right answer.  Any politician thinking this is a good idea needs their head examining. #judicialreview next. https://t.co/ftBCfPsX8u

@MickLacey People like this know full well they're talking BS. We've had @EnvAgency ecologists claiming they can re-create ancient SSSI grassland in under 10 years. These people go unchallenged because the professional bodies for ecologists are run by & for development consultants.

Work is starting on Sincil Dyke outside the @LincolnCity_FC stadium as part of our ¬£5 million Lincoln flood defence project.

tweets.text: In 2013 around 1,100 properties and 7,000ha of land around the Humber was flooded due to a tidal surge. Climate change means these events could happen more frequently. Make a plan and be prepared #PrepareActSurvive @EnvAgencyYNE  https://t.co/llOVfU9SUa https://t.co/5xSjNgxQdH

If you live in a flood risk area you should be prepared for #flooding.
This #FloodActionWeek we want to make you aware that you can:
- Sign up for flood warnings
- Make a simple flood plan 
- Know what to do in a flood
Find out how at: https://t.co/ZEHl74ryiJ
#PrepareActSurvive https://t.co/cJaWeSQXrV
